intro: Ancistrocladus extensus var. pinangianus, commonly known as the Pinangianus ancistrocladus, is a rare tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and distinctive, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Its botanical features include woody stems and small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
